statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Derrick Henry scored 18 points and Warren Sledge added 17, including five 3-pointers, to help The Citadel beat Georgia Southern 95-90 in the Palmetto State Shootout on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Henry, Sledge lead The Citadel past Georgia Southern 95-90
article.linkText: Henry, Sledge lead The Citadel past Georgia Southern 95-90
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Derrick Henry scored 18 points and Warren Sledge added 17, including five 3-pointers, to help The Citadel beat Georgia Southern 95-90 in the Palmetto State Shootout on Wednesday night. Henry made 4 of 6 from 3-point range. Quinton Marshall had 13 points, nine rebounds and six assists, Quayson Williams scored 11 and P.J. Boutte finished with 10 points and 10 assists for The Citadel (3-1). Georgia Southern (1-3) made just 28 of 67 (42 percent) field goals, while the Bulldogs shot 51 percent from the field, but grabbed 21 offensive rebounds and scored 23 second-chance points. The Citadel, which had gone nearly two calendar years since scoring at least 90 point in a single game before a 94-93 win over Stetson Nov. 17, is averaging 100 points in its last four games. Freshman Tookie Brown led Georgia Southern with a season-high 26 points and added five assists.
